law.catch_line: Peace officer may take child to court-approved center -- Release of child without formal charges filed.
law.text:
The peace officer may divert the child from the formal court process and take the child to a court-approved center offering voluntary services to children and release the child without formal charges being filed, if:
The offense the child has allegedly committed under the provisions of KRS 610.010(1) is not a felony offense;
The peace officer has received the permission of the parent or other responsible adult; and
The peace officer has followed guidelines which the court has established for such release.
law.history: Amended 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 87, sec. 19, effective July 15, 2008. -- Created 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 350, sec. 31, effective April 10, 1988.
